page.title: 06Churches in Alderney I
page.content: The Catholic Church was built in 1953,and seats 120 people.It has 6 stained glass windows,4 are of the apostles,and the other two are of St.Anne and St.Mary Magdalen.Around the back half of the church,on the wall,are wooden carvings of the journey of Jesus,as he walked up the road to Calvary carrying the cross. Father Bradley is the Father of the church,and lives in the house next door to it.Two sisters come over from Guernsey and live near the church also.One of them,Sister Francis,is Head of the Infants Department at St.Anne's school. The main island church is Church of England and is in the See of Winchester.The church is a magnificent building - sometimes called "The Cathedral of The Channel Isles"
